body_html:
Sorry to reopen an old thread: but the following code fails:

batch1 = torch.randn(10, 5, 20)
batch2 = torch.randn(10, 20)

test = torch.matmul(batch1, batch2)

What is the correct way of computing the batched matrix vector product between batch1 and batch2?

body:
Sorry to reopen an old thread: but the following code fails:

```
batch1 = torch.randn(10, 5, 20)
batch2 = torch.randn(10, 20)

test = torch.matmul(batch1, batch2)
```

What is the correct way of computing the batched matrix vector product between `batch1` and `batch2`?
